bill_title: To authorize a legislative study for the continuum of care for the disabled and elderly of South Dakota.

bill_versions.bill_text: A CONCURRENT RESOLUTION, To authorize a legislative study for the continuum of care for the disabled and elderly of South Dakota. WHEREAS, the planning, development, and implementation of innovative models for the delivery of care and Medicaid funding for the disabled and elderly of South Dakota is necessary; and WHEREAS, such efforts would result in access, delivery, regulatory compliance, and financial support that contributes to the sustainability of services to the disabled and elderly in South Dakota; and WHEREAS, there are several critical factors of consideration including population demographics, population to be served, needs of the population, current models and locations, access to resources, workforce needs, quality and regulatory standards, models and financing in surrounding states, and other issues appropriate to study for strategic planning; and WHEREAS, it is necessary to have a variety of parties involved, including bipartisan legislative membership from the House and Senate, members of the executive branch, providers that deliver these critical services, representatives from the Department of Social Services, representatives from the Department of Human Services; and advocate groups for those disabled and elderly populations: NOW, THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, by the House of Representatives of the Ninety-Fifth Legislature of the State of South Dakota, the Senate concurring therein, that an interim study of no more than twenty-five members be created, with members to be selected by the Executive Board, and to be co-chaired by a member of the House and Senate, with subgroups being authorized of no more than fifteen members; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that agencies of the state or any organization that has a contract with the state shall cooperate with the Legislature and this study for the purpose of providing facts, figures, data, projections, and other information as needed; and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that the interim study shall provide an interim report to the Executive Board prior to the 2021 Legislative session and to the full Legislature during the 2021 session, as well as present a final report to the Executive Board prior to the 2022 Legislative session and to the full Legislature during the 2022 session: and BE IT FURTHER RESOLVED, that legislative study established under this resolution shall be under the supervision of the Executive Board of the Legislative Research Council and staffed and funded as an interim legislative committee.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
